heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 21 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.5°C) and outside temperature (up 3.3°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4247 lux) and cloud levels (up 695 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 200.7m lower than yesterday, 695.1m lower than the past week, 367.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 929m and a high of 2240m, averaging 1344.5m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air moisture should feel ok and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The sun is below the horizon, it is probably not the optimal time to be hanging out your washing.
